What is algorithmic Trading and how is algo trading different from manual trading?
{" "} What is algorithmic Trading and how is algo trading different from manual trading?


Living in this ever changing era of revolution powered by computation. All the auctions in our stock exchanges are done with the help of computers. So that is from where the idea of {" "} algorithmic trading {" "} emerged and came into existence. It is nothing but a way for the automation of the order requests that people put in manually and then is sent over the network and the transactions take place. What about automating that mechanism. Algorithmic trading first entered{" "} {" "} stock market {" "} in mid-1980s, and today it constitutes nearly 70 per cent of total trading volumes in developed markets.{" "} {" "} Algorithmic trading {" "} in India is also catching up with the developed markets with total turnover being nearly 50% up form a merely 9.26 % in 2010.

Now there are two things that come with automation, first and the foremost the accuracy at which the orders are placed, and secondly the number of times the orders are places. Using set of instruction, which is called an algorithm being given to these machines that execute these trades based on certain conditions set by the user, these machines can perform these trades 100 or 1000 times even in a second without any error but with more accuracy and precision than done manually.

This increases the entire efficiency of the trades happening around the globe and reduces the chance of error by human due to innumerable reasons. Also, since humans have a tendency to get attached to things, this technique reduces that scope as the orders here are completely taken care of by the machines. Due to the number of trades being executed per second it gives birth to a new type of trades called the High Frequency Trading. They execute these trades at a very high speeds in different markets keeping in mind the multiple decision parameters based on preprogrammed instructions.

This is used in many forms of{" "} investing and trading{" "} activities by the varied varieties of investors that are there in the market.

It is not just used in day trading but is also used for mid and long term investment by the firms which want to buy or sell large volume of stocks at a certain price without disturbing or influencing the stock prices. Firms like pension funds, mutual funds and insurance companies use algorithmic trading for these purposes.

It is different from manual trading in the manner that trades are executed with the help of machines and computers instead of humans. Trades are executed at best possible prices, timely corrected and instantly to avoid significant price changes, reduced transaction costs, automated checks on multiple market conditions, can be backtested based on historical and real-time data to see if it is a viable trading strategy or not.

Kuants {" "} is the first online platform in India which provides{" "} Algorithmic Trading Strategies . To know more about us and our idea click on the link:{" "} Kuants Blog
